briefTitle: Study of Efficacy and Long-Term Safety of Mometasone Furoate in Combination With Formoterol Fumarate Versus Mometasone Furoate in Children (5 to 11 Years of Age) With Persistent Asthma (MK-0887A-087)
officialTitle: A Phase III, Randomized, Active-Controlled, Parallel-Group Clinical Trial to Study the Efficacy and Long-Term Safety of Mometasone Furoate/Formoterol Fumarate (MF/F, MK-0887A [SCH418131]), Compared With Mometasone Furoate (MF, MK-0887 [SCH032088]), in Children With Persistent Asthma
summary: This study compares the 12-week efficacy and 24-week safety of mometasone furoate/formoterol fumarate (MF/F) 100/10 mcg and mometasone furate (MF) 100 mcg, both administered twice daily (BID) via metered-dose inhaler (MDI) in children aged 5 to 11 years with persistent asthma.

primaryOutcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Morning (AM) Post-Dose % Predicted Forced Expiratory Volume in One Second (FEV1) in the Area Under the Curve (AUC)0-60
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Baseline, and average of Day 1, Weeks 1, 4, 8, and 12
